summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. It discusses logistical planning for interviews, noting that 16 subpoenas have been served and requesting 10 agents to be on standby to assist with a potential surge of interviewees.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Author of the initial email requesting 10 people to be on standby to assist with interviews for the Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Forwarded the email request for standby assistance to another recipient.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in coordinating resources for the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Subpoenas Served
events.description: As part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death, the FBI team served 16 subpoenas and anticipated a surge of people needing interviews.

events.title: Planned Interview Surge
events.description: The FBI team planned for potential interviews on Monday and/or Tuesday following the service of subpoenas, requiring additional agent standby.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 17, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The FBI had served 16 subpoenas as part of the Epstein death investigation.
The FBI team anticipated a surge of people needing to be interviewed on August 19-20, 2019.
The email requested 10 FBI agents to be on standby to assist with interviews if needed.
